name: Havana Slow Cooker Pork Tenderloin
author: Amanda
summary: This dish has bright flavors and becomes incredibly easy too with the help of a slow cooker! I came up with this recipe with the flavors and style of cooking meat slowly, inspired by my friend from Cuba.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon grill seasoning (such as Montreal Steak Seasoning®)
directions: Arrange onion slices in the bottom of a slow cooker; top with pork tenderloin
Sprinkle garlic evenly over onion and pork
Pour orange juice, vinegar, and lemon juice over pork
Sprinkle cumin, grill seasoning, salt, red pepper, bay leaves, and lemon zest over pork
Cover and cook on Low until pork is very tender, 6 to 7 hours
To serve, slice tenderloin into 1 1/2-inch slices, arrange on a platter, and drizzle juices over top
